top_categories.workout_context: 50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)'s Mississippi hills, Southern gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
At OMG (Oxford MS Gravel), surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
50 miles on Mississippi hills gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of OMG (Oxford MS Gravel). Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)'s demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before January.
Varied gradients on Mississippi hills gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Base fitness for OMG (Oxford MS Gravel). Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
When someone attacks on Mississippi hills gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At OMG (Oxford MS Gravel), that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
The aerobic base that lets you ride Mississippi hills gravel at tempo for 50 miles without cracking. No shortcuts.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mississippi hills gravel to build confidence. Expect: mississippi hills, southern gravel, southeast us.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of mississippi hills gravel in Oxford, MS.
